meanings.meaning: Essentially the same as P0136 and P0137 and P0131, a P0151 code refers to the first oxygen sensor on Bank 2 . P0151 means the O2 oxygen sensor's voltage remained low for longer than 2 minutes. This, is interpreted by the ECM as a low voltage condition and sets the MIL. Bank 2 Sensor 1 is located in front of the catalytic converter.

causes.cause: High resistance or open on O2 signal circuit
Short to voltage on O2 signal circuit

descriptions.description: Oxygen O2 Sensor Circuit Low Voltage (Bank 2, Sensor 1)

solutions.solution: Repair short, open, or high resistance on o2 signal circuit

symptoms.symptom: There may be no visible symptoms to the driver, other than the MIL (Check Engine / Service Engine Soon) illumination.
